file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 52-31-04-04 - BAGGAGE DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BAGGAGE DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH DOOR LOCK 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for removal and installation of the baggage-door skin protection. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE-DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - 52-31-04-000-801-A DOOR LOCK REMOVAL AIRCRAFT WITH BAGGAGE-DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - 52-31-04-400-801-A DOOR LOCK INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 52-31-04 Page 1 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-31-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH DOOR LOCK 2. BAGGAGE-DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the baggage-door skin protection. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-31-00/1 BAGGAGE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING AMM TASK 52-31-00-000-801-A/400 MECHANISM - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 813 Baggage door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic spatula To remove adhesive epoxy available Commercially Heat Gun To remove skin guard available Commercially Thermometer -40 to +100 ÃÂ°C (-40 to To apply hot air available +212 ÃÂ°F) Minimum Range Commercially Pair of pliers To remove skin guard available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - (MEK) AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 2 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Maintenance shop I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. (2) Open the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-31-00/1). (3) Remove the actuating handle ( AMM TASK 52-31-00-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) With a pair of pliers, bend the tab. Refer to Figure 401, View C. WARNING: OBEY THE SAFETY PRECAUTIONS WHEN YOU DO TASKS WITH A HEATING GUN. IF YOU USE AN INCORRECT HEAT GUN NEAR FLAMMABLE MATERIAL OR FUEL VENT, EXPLOSION CAN OCCUR. (2) With a heat gun, apply hot air to the skin guard. (3) With a thermometer, control the temperature. Refer to Figure 401, DET. B. NOTE: The temperature must not be higher than 92ÃÂ°C (197.6ÃÂ°F). (4) Remove and discard the skin guard. (5) With an acrylic spatula, remove the old adhesive epoxy. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (6) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 3 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH DOOR LOCK Baggage-Door Skin Protection - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 1 A ZONE 813 B DET. A DOOR SKIN (REF.) 1 PROTECTIVE C FILM 15 mm (0.6 in) 4 2 SKIN GUARD THERMOMETER 3 DET. B HEAT GUN 1 MARK THE WORK AREA WITH 3 LOCATE FIRST. POROUS-POINT PEN. 2 4 USE No. 180 SANDPAPER. GSE 491. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH DOOR LOCK Baggage-Door Skin Protection - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 D SKIN GUARD D VIEW C 6 DOOR SKIN (REF.) EXCESSIVE BOND (CLEAR) 5 SKIN GUARD SECTION D-D 5 COMPLETELY FILL WITH ADHESIVE EPOXY. 6 USE No. 180 SANDPAPER. EM145AMM520701F.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 5 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 52-31-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH DOOR LOCK 3. BAGGAGE-DOOR SKIN PROTECTION - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the baggage-door skin protection. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 52-31-00/1 BAGGAGE-DOOR ACTUATING AND LOCKING AMM TASK 52-31-00-400-801-A/400 MECHANISM - INSTALLATION IPC 52-31-00 BAGGAGE DOOR - ACTUATING LOCKING SYSTEM SRM 51-10-02-PR - SRM 51-10-03-PR - SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 813 Baggage door D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic spatula To install the sealant available GSE 491 To install the skin guard Commercially Heat Gun To install skin guard available Commercially Thermometer -40 to +100 ÃÂ°C (-40 to To apply hot air available +212 ÃÂ°F) Minimum Range Commercially Pair of pliers To install skin guard available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available Commercially Porous-point pen mark To make marks on the skin 1 available EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 6 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) EA9320NA Epoxy Adhesive Type II - (MEP 09-066) AR Commercially available Adhesive tape AR Commercially available Sandpaper No. 350 AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Skin guard IPC 52-31-00 1 H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Maintenance shop I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) With a felt-tip pen, draw the area where the skin guard will be bonded, 15 mm (0.6 in) offset all along the handle contour. Refer to (Figure 401), DET. B. (2) With masking tape, protect the door skin around the area defined. (3) With sandpaper No. 350, sand the area defined on the door skin where the skin guard will be bonded and the surface of the skin guard, on the side that will be in contact with door skin. Rework the affected area. Refer to SRM 51-10-02-PR and SRM 51-10-03- PR. WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING WHEN YOU HANDLE THEM. DO NOT BREATHE THEIR GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (4) With a cloth soaked in MEK, clean the surface. (5) Remove the protective surface film from the skin guard and discard the film. CAUTION:BONDING OPERATION MUST BE DONE IMMEDIATELY AFTER THE SURFACES ARE SANDED/CLEANED, PROVIDED THE TWO SURFACES ARE DRY. Apply epoxy adhesive to the surface of the skin guard, on the side that will be in contact with the door skin. Refer to (Figure 401); View C. (6) NOTE: The bond must fully fill the space between the skin guard and the door skin. Refer to SRM 51-20-01-PR. (7) Install the skin guard. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 7 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (8) Use GSE 491 to adjust the position of the skin guard. Refer to (Figure 401); DET. B. NOTE: The epoxy-adhesive curing time changes with the environmental conditions. If necessary, with a heat gun, apply hot air and control the temperature. (9) Remove excess epoxy adhesive. Refer to (Figure 401); SECTION D-D. NOTE: Use an acrylic spatula. (10) Remove GSE 491. Refer to (Figure 401); DET. B. (11) With a pair of pliers, bend the tab. Refer to (Figure 401), View C. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the actuating handle ( AMM TASK 52-31-00-400-801-A/400). (2) Close the baggage door (AMM SDS 52-31-00/1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 52-31-04 Page 8 of 8 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
